index.screenText:
Select the appropriate options.
Q9. A bacterial culture follows the growth equation y = 4x where y is the number of bacteria after x seconds. Which of the following graphs represents the exponential function? What is the doubling time? What is the rate constant k?

options.option: <font face="calibribold" size='3.1'>graph d, doubling time 0.5, k = 2</font>
<font face="calibribold" size='3.1'>graph c, doubling time 4, k = 1</font>
<font face="calibribold" size='3.1'>graph d, doubling time 16, k = 2</font>
<font face="calibribold" size='3.1'>graph b, doubling time 14, k = 1</font>
<font face="calibribold" size='3.1'>graph d, doubling time 4, k = unknown</font>

index.FeedbackIncorrect:
Not Quite!

The Correct Answer is: Option A

Read the explanation below to clear your understanding.
At x = 0 s, y = 40 = 1 meaning you start with one bacterium. At x = 1, y = 41 = 4 meaning this bacterium doubles every 0.5 s. So, doubling time 0.5 s. So k = 10.5 = 2 s-1. This makes sense, because the equation can be written as y = 4X = (22)x = 22x. Thus k = 2 by comparing with y = 2kx. From, this consideration, we have seen the graph passes through (0, 1) and (1, 4). Among the given four graphs, only graph d passes through these two points.
